page.title: 09S.ELKINGTON CHURCH & CHAPEL
page.content: {S.Elkington Church}dedicated to All Saint's,is in the Louth Parish of Churches.There is no resident parson in the village.The 13th C. chalk and stone building,restored in Victorian times is maintained by fund activities & covenanting.Sunday services at 11.00a.m.Holy Communion alternating with Matins,with average attendance of 12 parishioners.Carol and Harvest services popular with families, the younger generation reading lessons. A local family ring the three ancient bells;the organist travels from Fotherby.The church and graveyard tidied by the Church Wardens and residents. Baptisms-15, Weddings-12 Funerals-12 approx.annual figures. {The Methodist Chapel}built in 1896 is in the Louth Circuit.Sunday service at 2.30p.m.attended by a small but caring number of the community.
